FuncDef:
The time-delay-detect threshold command sets a delay threshold.
The undo time-delay-detect threshold command restores the default delay threshold.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, the delay threshold for MP-group member links is 30*100us.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delay threshold for MP-group member links.
The value is an integer ranging from 25 to 500, in 100 us. By default, the delay threshold is 30 * 100 us.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Delay detection for MP-group member links enables the device to send a detection packet every second to detect the transmission delay on each MP-group member link. To set a transmission delay threshold, run the time-delay-detect threshold time-delay-threshold command. If the transmission delay on a member link reaches the threshold, services to be transmitted on the member link are switched to another member link.
Configuration Impact
If the delay threshold changes, the device re-detects the delay on each MP-group member link. If the delay of a member link that is disabled from transmitting services falls below the new delay threshold, the member link is enabled to transmit services again.
